Plz try to clear the meta info of workspace.
This error occurs with a newly created workspace as well.

The fact that it works on your desktop is good for you and, on some level helpful, however we have mutiple machines on which it does not work one of which is a newly installed OS (Linux) and complete (all of Callisto except C/C++) Eclipse 3.2.

(In reply to comment #4)
> The fact that it works on your desktop is good for you and, on some level
> helpful, however we have mutiple machines on which it does not work one of
> which is a newly installed OS (Linux) and complete (all of Callisto except
> C/C++) Eclipse 3.2. 

You mean that you have BIRT and eclipse on same status on multiple machines and the start report failure only happens on one of them? If so, it seems the trouble doesn't comes from BIRT. 

Besides, did you check out BIRT source into a new workspace and launch the BIRT and then start a report? OR, you just started the BIRT with a new BIRT report workspace?  

As it indicates ClassNotFound on "ReportEditorProxy", what about check whether it is there first? And if yes, then try to re-check out the plugin "org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide", and clean the previous build and re-build BIRT again to check.

No, BIRT does not work on any of the machines; I am seeing the error above on all of them.  These include three Linux boxes (one of which just so happens to be completely newly installed OS and Eclipse) and as of yesterday (when I did an update) also on a Windows machine.

I believe if you download a copy of Eclipse 3.2, install it, and then install all of Callisto (less C/C++ in my case), you will see this error.

No, I have not looked at the BIRT sources.  I have looked at the latest version of the org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide jar file (which is org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ide_2.1.1.v20060926-0959.jar on my systems) and the ReportEditorsProxy class is included.

After installing eclipse and loading birt on a new laptop running linux,  I get an error when i switch to the birt perspective.  The error reads -
Problem opening perspective
org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.ReportPerspective.

This is a new install with a new workspace.  There appears to be a problem with the installation of birt within eclipse.

I had the same problem after I've made an update on BIRT. It seems that 2 packages in this update were broken. I found the 2 packages 'org.mozilla.rhino_1.6.0.v20061108-0630' and 'org.apache.commons.codec_1.3.0.v20061108-0630' where the jars in the lib folder are zipped and packed like this one 'commons-codec-1.3.jar.pack.gz'.
As a workaround to get BIRT running again you can switch back to a prior version of this 2 packages (you can do this in 'Help->SoftwareUpdate->Manage Configuration').

(In reply to comment #8)
Stefan,

Thank you for the information and confirmation of this issue.  I should have added that we are aware that if we happen to be on a machine which already had BIRT/Eclipse installed, we can switch back to a prior version.  As it happens, we have a couple of machines with newly installed OS, etc. and are encouraging others to use BIRT.

We wanted to make sure this issue was reported.  Sounds like it's known, now.

I have tried it both on Linux and Windows machine as you mentioned. Yes, the issues on starting BIRT do happen after recent update. Actually, BIRT doesn't work in this case.

As Stefan pointed, seems the latest packages of 'org.mozilla.rhino' and
'org.apache.commons.codec' cause the problem, because these two packges change to use '.pack.gz' archive, and eclipse has problem on extracting such archive recently. So, BIRT cannot work since lost these two plugins.

Besides, the update on the latest 'org.mozilla.rhino' and
'org.apache.commons.codec' can only be achieve in case the eclipse use JDK 1.5. I think that's why your guys run into the failure with newly installed Linux and eclipse callisto, because the default JDK on eclipse is 1.5.

Pass this issue to BIRT Build team to solved. 
Thanks very much for you guys reported it and your supports on BIRT!

(In reply to comment #10)

Thanks for the response and for all the great work on BIRT!!

Updated correct update jars.

The origianl generated update jars by PDE tools has .pack.gz files in .jar file, which leads to error when using update manager in JDK1.4.(the .gz runtime jar can not be unpack correctly in jdk1.4)

Using JDK1.5 should work well when unpacking .gz pack200 files.

Anyway, it should be fine with current update site.
